Artillery Sight / 火炮瞄具

The first artillery sights released on live.warthunder.com. This sight is intended for use with the Chinese and Soviet low-pressure guns in the indirect fire role.
The sight is developed using ZBD04A. It can be used for ZBD04A, BMD-4, and BMP-3. I do not have access to BMP-3, so the quality of its sight is lower.
Thanks to @AFatSkylark for some of the code, including the idea of including shell flight time.
artillerysight_ZBD04A.blk - style shown in pictures 1 and 3, for ZBD04A
artillerysight_ZBD04A_X.blk - style shown in pictures 2 and 4, for ZBD04...

#akagi #azur_lane #anime #sight

This is the site I customize and use.
Basically, it will work for any tank, but it does not take into account when the tank's camera is zoomed in.
The image is of the Abrams series, but it looks different when zoomed in on a tank with a low zoom ratio, such as a Type 90 tank.
I use it on MBT vehicles such as the American Abrams series and the Japanese Type 90.

sight color
Open the file and change the color to your liking.
The file consists of RGB color codes.

PS
I was going to write a little about changing the visibility distance, etc., but it would be tedious to expl...

SEMI HISTORICAL XM-803 & MBT/KPZ-70 SIGHTS
Tested on 1080p only

DISCLAIMER: The MBT-70 and KPz-70 sights might be unhistorical, due to no documentation of their sights. Due to lack of documentation, I based their sights off of the XM-803 sight.

Sights are based off of XM-803 Operator's Manual.

Source: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1EtkM7Nk5uXVM5sspVnTnxeF-cTdfg8ysaxZv1L5S7o0/

#sight #usa #america #germany #semihistorical #mbt70 #kpz70

#torm1

FW_CN_TORM1_80180_D1

Zoom :8.0x-18.0x

Usage method : Put the. blk file in the folder of the vehicle，Restart the game，Select a custom sight in Game Options - General Combat Settings
Example : E:\SteamLibrary\steamapps\common\War Thunder\UserSights\cn_tor_m1

使用说明 : 把.blk文件放到对应载具的文件夹内，重启游戏或重新加载自定义瞄具，在游戏选项-通用战斗设置中选择自定义瞄具。
例 : E:\SteamLibrary\steamapps\common\War Thunder\UserSights\cn_tor_m1

#vt4a1 #ztz99a #wz1001e

FW_CN_VT4A1_D1
FW_CN_VT4A1_C1
FW_CN_ZTZ99A_60110_D1
FW_CN_WZ1001E_60110_D1

Zoom :
VT4A1 : 6.0x-10.0x
ZTZ99A : 6.0x-11.0x
WZ1001E（ZTZ99A）：6.0x-11.0x

Usage method : Put the. blk file in the folder of the vehicle，Restart the game，Select a custom sight in Game Options - General Combat Settings
Example : E:\SteamLibrary\steamapps\common\War Thunder\UserSights\cn_wz_1001

使用说明 : 把.blk文件放到对应载具的文件夹内，重启游戏或重新加载自定义瞄具，在游戏选项-通用战斗设置中选择自定义瞄具。
例 : E:\SteamLibrary\steamapps\common\War Thunder\UserSights\cn_wz_1001

Sights designed for radar SPAAGs

1.5~6x, 2~6x and 5x variants included, which should be usable on most of the target SPAAs.

- A clean design for searching targets with eye balls
- 45-degree reticles for identifying slight turns of enemy aircraft (with the leading? line from radar shown)

Installation:
Extract and drop the blk files into [GameFolder]/UserSights/all_tanks

---

Source code (in JavaScript) for generating the sight can be found at https://github.com/pzvol/wt-sight-generator/tree/main/sights2 . Feel free to modify if anyone is interested...

If you want to fix the wavy texture inside the boxes, change:

crosshairColor:c = 210,209,208,1000

to:

crosshairColor:c = 255,255,255,1000

#historical #ikv91 #sweden #light_tank

UPDATE 12/4-2024
~HISTORICAL T-55M SIGHT~
(Actually semi-historical until they get the correct zoom)

The Finnish T-55M uses an upgraded Fire Control System from Sweden, the Bofors FCS-FV/K. This FCS uses the CelsiusTech Type FV sight for the gunner, with a day magnification of 7x (9°) and a night magnification of 8.5x (5.3°). In-game, we have 3x-7x magnification, and until they fix that to 7x, I won't be adding FOV limiters since it covers too much of the screen.

I got this reticle sent to me from the Parola Tank Museum in Finland, so I guess it is from the ...

Custom Senko sight for all tanks, idk what to say

#senko #senko_san #senkosan #fictional #anime

~SEMI-HISTORICAL M3 AND M3A3 BRADLEY SIGHTS~
Link to historical pack: https://live.warthunder.com/post/1101611/en/

The M3 Bradley uses the Integrated Sight Unit (Pictures 1 and 2), or ISU for short. This sight has a double magnification of 4x and 12x. The reticle consists of the gunsight reticle and a stadiametric rangefinder for 500m, 1km, 2km and 3km.

The M3A3 Bradley uses the Improved Bradley Acquisition Subsystem (Pictures 3-8), or IBAS for short. This highly advanced sight has 4x and 12x optical magnifications and 2x and 4x electronic zoom. The IBAS has ...

Update 2-14-25: Reformatted to use BiCubic MipMaps without error/gamma correction. This will provide superior clarity, especially on lower resolutions.

Special thanks to KnirkeDK!

Rocket and gun sight pack for the F84b and F84g Thunderjets. Intended for Tiny Tims at 600m and 1000m. Dive angle is very generous due to high average IAS, so come in shallow or steep!

Install by unzipping included UserSkins folder to your War Thunder game root and combine with any existing fold...

Universal sight pack I made (Can be used by any tank)

Template + Preview
You can edit .blk file if you want more customisation (I put comment after "//")

The 4 line above the X axis is for emergency situation when you set your range too far
(//Root and //Warning in .blk file)

Heightfinder apply for tank with ~2.5m height (Abrams, T10M, IS-2, ...)

Note:
SLOW/MED/FAST: Shell speed
RF: Heightfinder
ITL: Interlaced
LZ: Low zoom
S5/S10/S15: Size

Inspired by Minedeployder
https://live.warthunder.com/post/851372/en/

#universal

A customized game default sight

1. Shell correction ticks per 400m with rectified ticks' lengths
2. Variants with different correction number positions (one side/both sides)
3. Both green-red and default black-red color schemes provided
4. Modified central cross for clearer vision
5. Gun center(0m) prompt

Installation:
Extract and drop the blk files into [GameFolder]/UserSights/all_tanks

---

Source code (in JavaScript) for generating the sight can be found at https://github.com/pzvol/wt-sight-generator/tree/main/sights2 . Feel free to modify if anyone is i...
